newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: RESEARCH ALERT - Buy Sunright, says DBS.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Buy Sunright, says DBS.

text.p: DBS Investment said on Friday it was recommending a buy on semiconductor testing company Sunright Ltd on expectations of an average earnings growth of 20 percent in the next two fiscal years.
Sunright should garner more orders after data from the United States suggested the semiconductor industry was turning around, DBS said in a statement.
DBS said the company's earnings for the year ending July 1997 should be boosted by the sale of its GEN machines, which perform parallel test and burn-in processes for semiconductors.

"In our estimates, we assume that Sunright will sell 13 GEN machines in fiscal 1997 and 25 machines in fiscal 1998. At Singapore $450,000 per machine, revenue from the GEN machines will amount to S$5.85 million in fiscal 1997 and S$11.25 million in fiscal 1998," said DBS.
Sunright sold one such machine in fiscal 1996.
DBS said Sunright had also been shifting towards higher-margin products and upgrading its testing and burn-in facilities to cater to the more lucrative 16MB memory chips.
